name: area
description: The area of ground the hex takes up, measured in acres

name: pH
description: The acidity or alkalinity of the soil, expressed on a scale from 0 to 14, and fundamentally dictates the availability of nutrients to the plant

name: P_in_soil
description: Current phosphorus level in soil (lbs per acre). Phosphorus is critical for root development and energy transfer

name: K_in_soil
description: Current potassium level in soil (lbs per acre). Potassium helps with disease resistance and water regulation

name: cec
description: Current CEC (Cation Exchange Capacity) level in soil (meq / 100g). Measure of a soil's ability to hold and supply positively charged nutrient ions

name: yield_target
description: The farmer's intended yield goal for the hexagon (bushels per acre). Higher values indicate areas with better yield potential

name: calcium
description: Current calcium level in soil (lbs per acre). Calcium strengthens plant cell walls, promotes root and shoot growth, and is essential for improving soil structure

name: magnesium
description: Current magnesium level in soil (lbs per acre). An essential secondary nutrient, a critical component of the chlorophyll molecule required for photosynthesis

name: N_in_soil
description: Current nitrogen level in soil (lbs per acre). Nitrogen is typically very low in soil tests as it's highly mobile. Most N comes from fertilizer application

name: N_to_apply
description: Recommended nitrogen fertilizer application amount (lbs per acre). Application rate based on yield target and soil test

name: P_to_apply
description: Recommended phosphorus fertilizer application amount (lbs per acre). Calculated based on soil test levels

name: K_to_apply
description: Recommended potassium fertilizer application amount (lbs per acre). Based on soil K levels and crop removal rates

name: geometry_wkt
description: Spatial polygon representing the hexagon boundary in Well-Known Text (WKT) format
